title: Madeleine McCann Case: Portugal to Renew Search for Long-Missing British Girl
description: The case of 3-year-old Madeleine McCann, who disappeared while vacationing with her family in Portugal, has drawn international attention for years.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing: Bakhmut in Ruins
description: Plus, China bans some U.S. chips.

title: Russia Claims Bakhmut, but Some See a Pyrrhic Victory
description: A top Ukrainian official essentially acknowledged that the devastated city had been lost. Thousands of Ukrainian and Russian soldiers died there, but the cost for Moscow was especially steep, experts say.

title: Sinn Fein Surges in Local Elections, Revealing a Divided Northern Ireland
description: As the party climbs, its rivals, the Democratic Unionists, are stalled, which means any compromise that could revive its power-sharing national government may remain elusive.

title: Alert Level Is Raised in Central Mexico as Volcano Spews Smoke and Ash
description: Officials were preparing evacuation routes and shelters around the volcano, Popocatépetl, and some schools and parks were closed to minimize exposure to falling ash.

title: Biden Sees Coming ‘Thaw’ With China, Even as He Rallies Allies Against Beijing
description: During the Group of 7 meeting that just wrapped up, President Biden forged a consensus approach toward China despite tensions between the major powers over their approach.

title: Erdogan Is Endorsed by Sinan Ogan
description: The support of Sinan Ogan gives the Turkish president a boost as he takes on the opposition leader Kemal Kilicdaroglu.

title: Fighting Reported in Russia’s Belgorod Region, Near the Border With Ukraine
description: The local Russian governor blamed a Ukrainian sabotage group, while Kyiv’s military intelligence agency said the perpetrators were “opposition-minded citizens of Russia.”

title: E.U. Asks Greece to Investigate Video of Migrants Left at Sea
description: Citing a report by The Times, a top E.U. official said the Greek authorities had been urged to investigate after footage showed the Greek Coast Guard leaving asylum seekers at sea.

title: Do-or-Die Talks Reach Deal to Keep Colorado River From Going Dry, for Now
description: The temporary agreement on cuts, aided by a wet winter and $1.2 billion in federal payments, only lasts until 2026.

title: Why Bakhmut? It’s a Question Older Than the Ukraine War.
description: The twists and turns of a war are rarely easy to predict. In Ukraine, they landed on a city in the east that few had ever heard of. And then the whole world watched for months.

title: What Bakhmut Looks Like Now
description: Drone footage taken by The New York Times captured the scorched buildings, destroyed schools and cratered parks that now define the city in eastern Ukraine.

title: Belarus Said to Pardon Roman Protasevich, Activist Who Was Hauled Off a Ryanair Flight
description: Roman Protasevich had been sentenced to eight years in prison. The details of his 2021 arrest drew international attention.

title: Fire in Guyana School Dormitory Kills at Least 20
description: Many of the victims in the overnight blaze were children, and the government was flying out some of the injured so they could receive treatment.

title: Supreme Court Criticism
description: Democrats used to criticize the Supreme Court respectfully. Increasingly, they see the court as irredeemable.

title: Shelling Briefly Knocks Out Power at Zaporizhzhia Nuclear Plant
description: Ukraine’s state energy company said it had restored power to the plant, Europe’s largest, hours after shelling severed the connection.

title: Typhoon Mawar Heads Toward Guam
description: Forecasters said the storm is strengthening as it approaches the Mariana Islands. A typhoon warning is now in effect for Guam and the nearby island of Rota.

title: Andrew Tate Finds Romania Less Lawless Than He Hoped
description: The online influencer, popular with young men, is facing charges of human trafficking and rape, after seeking out a place where “corruption is accessible to everybody.”

title: Mexican Official, Alejandro Encinas, Victim of Pegasus Spyware Attack
description: While looking into abuses by the armed forces, the country’s top human rights official was targeted with Pegasus, the world’s most notorious spyware, The Times found.

title: Zelensky wraps up another fruitful trip and Russia claims a big win in Ukraine.
France’s Latest Way to Sound Anger Over Pensions Law: Saucepans
description: Protesters have been harassing the French government in clanky demonstrations that have gone viral in a country with no shortage of kitchenware.

title: Fire Guts Manila’s Historic Post Office Building
description: Built in 1926, the structure is one of the Philippine capital’s most recognizable landmarks. The cause of the fire was unclear on Monday.

title: Your Monday Briefing
description: Russia’s assertions of victory in Bakhmut.
